note:
I'm a fat bipolar queer autistic antizionist Jew who is decently funny and has OCD, chronic pain, and 11 tattoos. What more could you possibly want?
---
I have a degree in queer research, education, and history and am a major sociology nerd. I mostly post about things relating to queerness, neurodivergency, disability/mental illness, and my wonderful little family (which consists of my absurdly sweet butch wife, two adorable dogs, and sassy senior cat).

My OCD makes me do some pattern stuff with social media timelines that is not possible if I follow a lot of people, so if I don't follow you back or unfollow you that is most likely why!

Feel free to boost any of my posts if you want to (on the pretty rare occasions I don’t want something boosted I make sure I set it to followers only), but please DO NOT repost anywhere with or without credit.

Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.
